summary: The Rural Health Training Opportunities Act (H.R. 5377) aims to increase geographical diversity in health profession opportunity grants under the Social Security Act. It mandates that preference be given to projects serving rural areas and requires these projects to include a transportation assistance plan for participants. The bill amends existing law to include provisions for grant application preferences, addressing rural workforce shortages, and mandating reports to Congress on the effectiveness of demonstration projects. It will take effect on October 1, 2025.
